original_title: Two Virginia students suspended after locker room incident with transgender classmate | Fox News
article_summary: Two Virginia students suspended for questioning transgender student's presence in boys' locker room, sparking parental outrage and accusations of bias from Virginia's Attorney General. The suspension, which includes a no-contact order and a requirement to meet with school administrators, has raised concerns about freedom of speech and the school's adherence to Policy 8040, which permits students to use facilities aligning with their gender identity.</s>
